title: Use cases
text: Suppose want analyse recent population data. indicator “0008273” population data. Let’s check dimensions available explore indicator: four available dimensions available indicator. Dimension 1 always time dimension. Dimension 2 always place dimension. dimensions vary indicator. case dimension 3 Sex dimension 4 Age group. recent time period? Alternative 1: Using get_metadata() function. function quickly shows first last time periods. However, provide id codes possible value, need along analysis. Alternative 2: Using get_dim_values() function. recent value 2022 advantage approach shows categ_cod variable, can pass dimN parameters get_ine_data() function obtain subset available data. see 344 geographic units, including NUTS 1, NUTS 2, NUTS 3 municipalities disaggregated level. MF, M F sexes available. Five year age groups available. Now suppose want compare population size across NUTS 3, available sexes age groups. (Note NUTS 3 3-character categ_cod). ineptR::get_ine_data() function conveniently allows us request desired data: Important: parameters passed ineptR::get_ine_data() subset categ_cod values obtained ineptR::get_dim_values(). example passed subset values dim1 dim2, however can use approach combination available dimensions.
code: indicator <- "0008273" #Resident population (No.) by Place of residence (NUTS - 2013), Sex and Age group; Annual get_dim_info(indicator, lang = "EN") # Default lang is PT #> # A tibble: 4 × 4 #>   dim_num abrv                             versao nota_dsg                       #>   <chr>   <chr>                            <chr>  <chr>                          #> 1 1       Data reference period            XXXXX  "2021, Provisional Resident P… #> 2 2       Place of residence (NUTS - 2013) 03505  "Resident Population Estimate… #> 3 3       Sex                              00305   NA                            #> 4 4       Age group                        00708   NA indicator_metadata <- ineptR::get_metadata(indicator, lang = "EN") indicator_metadata #> $IndicadorCod #> [1] "0008273" #>  #> $IndicadorNome #> [1] "Resident population (No.) by Place of residence (NUTS - 2013), Sex and Age group; Annual - Statistics Portugal, Annual estimates of resident population" #>  #> $Periodic #> [1] "Annual" #>  #> $PrimeiroPeriodo #> [1] "2011" #>  #> $UltimoPeriodo #> [1] "2022" #>  #> $UnidadeMedida #> [1] "Number (No.)" #>  #> $Potencia10 #> [1] "0" #>  #> $PrecisaoDecimal #> [1] "0" #>  #> $Lingua #> [1] "EN" #>  #> $DataUltimaAtualizacao #> [1] "2023-06-15" #>  #> $DataExtracao #> [1] "2023-08-03T15:06:06.685+01:00"  most_recent_year <- indicator_metadata %>%    pluck("UltimoPeriodo") %>%    as.integer() most_recent_year #> [1] 2022 #Get a data frame with all the values for all dimensions dimension_values <- get_dim_values(indicator, lang = "EN")  #check the internal structure str(dimension_values) #> tibble [378 × 7] (S3: tbl_df/tbl/data.frame) #>  $ dim_num    : chr [1:378] "1" "1" "1" "1" ... #>  $ cat_id     : chr [1:378] "S7A2011" "S7A2012" "S7A2013" "S7A2014" ... #>  $ categ_cod  : chr [1:378] "S7A2011" "S7A2012" "S7A2013" "S7A2014" ... #>  $ categ_dsg  : chr [1:378] "2011" "2012" "2013" "2014" ... #>  $ categ_ord  : chr [1:378] "20110101" "20120101" "20130101" "20140101" ... #>  $ categ_nivel: chr [1:378] "1" "1" "1" "1" ... #>  $ value_id   : chr [1:378] "Dim_Num1_S7A2011" "Dim_Num1_S7A2012" "Dim_Num1_S7A2013" "Dim_Num1_S7A2014" ...  #Explore the values head(dimension_values) #> # A tibble: 6 × 7 #>   dim_num cat_id  categ_cod categ_dsg categ_ord categ_nivel value_id         #>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>     <chr>     <chr>     <chr>       <chr>            #> 1 1       S7A2011 S7A2011   2011      20110101  1           Dim_Num1_S7A2011 #> 2 1       S7A2012 S7A2012   2012      20120101  1           Dim_Num1_S7A2012 #> 3 1       S7A2013 S7A2013   2013      20130101  1           Dim_Num1_S7A2013 #> 4 1       S7A2014 S7A2014   2014      20140101  1           Dim_Num1_S7A2014 #> 5 1       S7A2015 S7A2015   2015      20150101  1           Dim_Num1_S7A2015 #> 6 1       S7A2016 S7A2016   2016      20160101  1           Dim_Num1_S7A2016  most_recent_year <- dimension_values %>%   filter(dim_num == 1) %>%   summarise(categ_dsg = max(as.integer(categ_dsg))) %>%   as.integer() #Exploring the other dimensions dimension_values %>% group_split(dim_num) #> <list_of< #>   tbl_df< #>     dim_num    : character #>     cat_id     : character #>     categ_cod  : character #>     categ_dsg  : character #>     categ_ord  : character #>     categ_nivel: character #>     value_id   : character #>   > #> >[4]> #> [[1]] #> # A tibble: 12 × 7 #>    dim_num cat_id  categ_cod categ_dsg categ_ord categ_nivel value_id         #>    <chr>   <chr>   <chr>     <chr>     <chr>     <chr>       <chr>            #>  1 1       S7A2011 S7A2011   2011      20110101  1           Dim_Num1_S7A2011 #>  2 1       S7A2012 S7A2012   2012      20120101  1           Dim_Num1_S7A2012 #>  3 1       S7A2013 S7A2013   2013      20130101  1           Dim_Num1_S7A2013 #>  4 1       S7A2014 S7A2014   2014      20140101  1           Dim_Num1_S7A2014 #>  5 1       S7A2015 S7A2015   2015      20150101  1           Dim_Num1_S7A2015 #>  6 1       S7A2016 S7A2016   2016      20160101  1           Dim_Num1_S7A2016 #>  7 1       S7A2017 S7A2017   2017      20170101  1           Dim_Num1_S7A2017 #>  8 1       S7A2018 S7A2018   2018      20180101  1           Dim_Num1_S7A2018 #>  9 1       S7A2019 S7A2019   2019      20190101  1           Dim_Num1_S7A2019 #> 10 1       S7A2020 S7A2020   2020      20200101  1           Dim_Num1_S7A2020 #> 11 1       S7A2021 S7A2021   2021      20210101  1           Dim_Num1_S7A2021 #> 12 1       S7A2022 S7A2022   2022      20220101  1           Dim_Num1_S7A2022 #>  #> [[2]] #> # A tibble: 344 × 7 #>    dim_num cat_id  categ_cod categ_dsg         categ_ord categ_nivel value_id    #>    <chr>   <chr>   <chr>     <chr>             <chr>     <chr>       <chr>       #>  1 2       PT      PT        Portugal          1         1           Dim_Num2_PT #>  2 2       1       1         Continente        2         2           Dim_Num2_1  #>  3 2       11      11        Norte             3         3           Dim_Num2_11 #>  4 2       111     111       Alto Minho        4         4           Dim_Num2_1… #>  5 2       1111601 1111601   Arcos de Valdevez 5         5           Dim_Num2_1… #>  6 2       1111602 1111602   Caminha           42        5           Dim_Num2_1… #>  7 2       1111603 1111603   Melgaço           57        5           Dim_Num2_1… #>  8 2       1111604 1111604   Monção            71        5           Dim_Num2_1… #>  9 2       1111605 1111605   Paredes de Coura  96        5           Dim_Num2_1… #> 10 2       1111606 1111606   Ponte da Barca    113       5           Dim_Num2_1… #> # ℹ 334 more rows #>  #> [[3]] #> # A tibble: 3 × 7 #>   dim_num cat_id categ_cod categ_dsg categ_ord categ_nivel value_id   #>   <chr>   <chr>  <chr>     <chr>     <chr>     <chr>       <chr>      #> 1 3       T      T         MF        1         1           Dim_Num3_T #> 2 3       1      1         M         2         2           Dim_Num3_1 #> 3 3       2      2         F         3         2           Dim_Num3_2 #>  #> [[4]] #> # A tibble: 19 × 7 #>    dim_num cat_id categ_cod categ_dsg         categ_ord categ_nivel value_id    #>    <chr>   <chr>  <chr>     <chr>             <chr>     <chr>       <chr>       #>  1 4       T      T         Total             10        1           Dim_Num4_T  #>  2 4       11     11        0 - 4 years       20        2           Dim_Num4_11 #>  3 4       12     12        5 - 9 years       80        2           Dim_Num4_12 #>  4 4       21     21        10 - 14 years     140       2           Dim_Num4_21 #>  5 4       22     22        15 - 19 years     200       2           Dim_Num4_22 #>  6 4       31     31        20 - 24 years     260       2           Dim_Num4_31 #>  7 4       32     32        25 - 29 years     320       2           Dim_Num4_32 #>  8 4       41     41        30 - 34 years     380       2           Dim_Num4_41 #>  9 4       42     42        35 - 39 years     440       2           Dim_Num4_42 #> 10 4       51     51        40 - 44 years     500       2           Dim_Num4_51 #> 11 4       52     52        45 - 49 years     560       2           Dim_Num4_52 #> 12 4       61     61        50 - 54 years     620       2           Dim_Num4_61 #> 13 4       62     62        55 - 59 years     680       2           Dim_Num4_62 #> 14 4       71     71        60 - 64 years     740       2           Dim_Num4_71 #> 15 4       72     72        65 - 69 years     800       2           Dim_Num4_72 #> 16 4       81     81        70 - 74 years     860       2           Dim_Num4_81 #> 17 4       82     82        75 - 79 years     920       2           Dim_Num4_82 #> 18 4       91     91        80 - 84 years     980       2           Dim_Num4_91 #> 19 4       92     92        85 and more years 1040      2           Dim_Num4_92 #Get the id of the latest time period latest_year_id <- dimension_values$categ_cod[dimension_values$categ_dsg == most_recent_year]  latest_year_id #> [1] "S7A2022"  #Get the id of all NUTS 3 nuts3_id <- dimension_values %>%    filter(str_length(categ_cod)==3) %>% #NUTS 3 have a 3-character code   pull(categ_cod)  nuts3_id #>  [1] "111" "112" "119" "11A" "11B" "11C" "11D" "11E" "16B" "16D" "16E" "16F" #> [13] "16G" "16H" "16I" "16J" "170" "181" "184" "185" "186" "187" "150" "200" #> [25] "300"  #Get the data indicator_output <- get_ine_data(indicator,                                   lang = "EN",                                   dim1 = latest_year_id,                                   dim2 = nuts3_id)

what: Example with a large and cumbersome dataset
title: Use cases
text: indicator Deaths (.) Place residence (NUTS - 2013), Sex, Age group Death cause (European short-list); Annual (6), ID “0008206” large dataset: limit 40k records per API call, extracting values result 1142 API calls best case scenario. take many hours might result memory errors API timeout. situations recommended approach iterate one dimensions (e.g. Time dimension), store data obtained iteration.
code: indicator <- "0008206" ineptR::get_dim_info(indicator, lang = "EN") #> # A tibble: 5 × 4 #>   dim_num abrv                              versao nota_dsg                      #>   <chr>   <chr>                             <chr>  <chr>                         #> 1 1       Data reference period             XXXXX  "International Classificatio… #> 2 2       Place of residence (NUTS - 2013)  03513  "From January 1st, 2015 came… #> 3 3       Sex                               00305  "The total number of deaths … #> 4 4       Age group (decennial)             03633  "In some situations of previ… #> 5 5       Death cause (European short-list) 00204  "The \"European short-list f…  #Check number of unique values by dimension unique_values <- ineptR::get_dim_values(indicator, lang = "EN") %>%    group_by(dim_num) %>%    summarise(unique_values = n())  unique_values #> # A tibble: 5 × 2 #>   dim_num unique_values #>   <chr>           <int> #> 1 1                  31 #> 2 2                 354 #> 3 3                   3 #> 4 4                  21 #> 5 5                  66

title: Authors and Citation
text: Carlos Matos. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Matos C (2023). ineptR: Get data Statistics Portugal (Instituto Nacional de Estatistica - Portugal) R. https://c-matos.github.io/ineptR, https://github.com/c-matos/ineptR.
code: @Manual{,   title = {ineptR: Get data from Statistics Portugal (Instituto Nacional de Estatistica - Portugal) to R},   author = {Carlos Matos},   year = {2023},   note = {https://c-matos.github.io/ineptR, https://github.com/c-matos/ineptR}, }

title: Get data from Statistics Portugal (Instituto Nacional de Estatistica - Portugal) to R
text: goal ineptR facilitate automate data extraction Statistics Portugal (Instituto Nacional de Estatistica - INE, PT) R. consists mainly wrapper functions around INE API, helper functions inspect metadata. One limitation INE API data extraction limited 40k data points API call. convenience, package deals limitation internally, user can get records single get_ine_data() function call. basic usage example, keep reading. -depth examples, check vignette("use_cases").

title: Get data from Statistics Portugal (Instituto Nacional de Estatistica - Portugal) to R
text: can install development version ineptR GitHub :

title: Get data from Statistics Portugal (Instituto Nacional de Estatistica - Portugal) to R
text: basic workflow inspect get data INE. Navigate INE website identify desired indicador ID. Example: Proportion domestic budget funded domestic taxes (%); Annual Get indicator ID indOcorrCod query parameter URL. case ID 001003 Confirm indicator ID valid: Inspect metadata: Get information dimensions: many dimensions indicator ? unique values dimension? Get data:
code: #Load package library(ineptR) #Check if indicator is valid is_indicator_valid("0010003") #> [1] TRUE get_metadata("0010003") #> $IndicadorCod #> [1] "0010003" #>  #> $IndicadorNome #> [1] "Percentagem do orçamento de Estado financiado por impostos cobrados internamente (%); Anual - Direção Geral do Orçamento (Ministério das Finanças)" #>  #> $Periodic #> [1] "Anual" #>  #> $PrimeiroPeriodo #> [1] "2010" #>  #> $UltimoPeriodo #> [1] "2023" #>  #> $UnidadeMedida #> [1] "Percentagem (%)" #>  #> $Potencia10 #> [1] "0" #>  #> $PrecisaoDecimal #> [1] "2" #>  #> $Lingua #> [1] "PT" #>  #> $DataUltimaAtualizacao #> [1] "2022-12-28" #>  #> $DataExtracao #> [1] "2023-08-02T17:10:46.383+01:00" get_dim_info("0010003") #> # A tibble: 2 × 3 #>   dim_num abrv                            versao #>   <chr>   <chr>                           <chr>  #> 1 1       Período de referência dos dados XXXXX  #> 2 2       Localização geográfica          03505 get_dim_values("0010003") #> # A tibble: 15 × 7 #>    dim_num cat_id  categ_cod categ_dsg categ_ord categ_nivel value_id         #>    <chr>   <chr>   <chr>     <chr>     <chr>     <chr>       <chr>            #>  1 1       S7A2010 S7A2010   2010      20100101  1           Dim_Num1_S7A2010 #>  2 1       S7A2011 S7A2011   2011      20110101  1           Dim_Num1_S7A2011 #>  3 1       S7A2012 S7A2012   2012      20120101  1           Dim_Num1_S7A2012 #>  4 1       S7A2013 S7A2013   2013      20130101  1           Dim_Num1_S7A2013 #>  5 1       S7A2014 S7A2014   2014      20140101  1           Dim_Num1_S7A2014 #>  6 1       S7A2015 S7A2015   2015      20150101  1           Dim_Num1_S7A2015 #>  7 1       S7A2016 S7A2016   2016      20160101  1           Dim_Num1_S7A2016 #>  8 1       S7A2017 S7A2017   2017      20170101  1           Dim_Num1_S7A2017 #>  9 1       S7A2018 S7A2018   2018      20180101  1           Dim_Num1_S7A2018 #> 10 1       S7A2019 S7A2019   2019      20190101  1           Dim_Num1_S7A2019 #> 11 1       S7A2020 S7A2020   2020      20200101  1           Dim_Num1_S7A2020 #> 12 1       S7A2021 S7A2021   2021      20210101  1           Dim_Num1_S7A2021 #> 13 1       S7A2022 S7A2022   2022      20220101  1           Dim_Num1_S7A2022 #> 14 1       S7A2023 S7A2023   2023      20230101  1           Dim_Num1_S7A2023 #> 15 2       PT      PT        Portugal  1         1           Dim_Num2_PT get_ine_data("0010003") #>    dim_1 geocod   geodsg valor #> 1   2010     PT Portugal 58.31 #> 2   2011     PT Portugal 60.04 #> 3   2012     PT Portugal 60.53 #> 4   2013     PT Portugal 58.92 #> 5   2014     PT Portugal  62.1 #> 6   2015     PT Portugal 61.28 #> 7   2016     PT Portugal 64.61 #> 8   2017     PT Portugal 64.55 #> 9   2018     PT Portugal 67.41 #> 10  2019     PT Portugal 69.16 #> 11  2020     PT Portugal 58.01 #> 12  2021     PT Portugal 60.72 #> 13  2022     PT Portugal 64.18 #> 14  2023     PT Portugal 66.08

title: Get information about the dimensions of a given indicator — get_dim_info
Get information about the dimensions of a given indicator — get_dim_info
text: indicator INE indicator ID 7 character string. Example: "0010003". lang One "PT" "EN". Default "PT".

title: Get information about the dimensions of a given indicator — get_dim_info
text: data frame dim_num (dimension number), abrv (dimension description) versao (dimension version) selected indicator. fourth column 'nota_dsg' present indicators, additional notes dimensions.

title: Get information about the dimensions of a given indicator — get_dim_info
text: indicator valid, returns 1x1 tibble column named 'value' stating "(PT) O codigo indicador nao existe. / (EN) indicator code exist."  Calling is_indicator_valid() using function recommended.

title: Get information about the dimensions of a given indicator — get_dim_info
code: get_dim_info("0010003") #> # A tibble: 2 × 3 #>   dim_num abrv                            versao #>   <chr>   <chr>                           <chr>  #> 1 1       Período de referência dos dados XXXXX  #> 2 2       Localização geográfica          03505

title: Get unique values for all dimensions of the indicator — get_dim_values
Get unique values for all dimensions of the indicator — get_dim_values
text: indicator INE indicator ID 7 character string. Example: "0010003". lang One "PT" "EN". Default "PT".

title: Get unique values for all dimensions of the indicator — get_dim_values
text: data frame dim_num (dimension number), cat_id (dimension description), categ_cod, categ_dsg (Category description), categ_ord (order category appears website), categ_nivel (hierarchical order) value_id (id row data frame) selected indicator.

title: Get unique values for all dimensions of the indicator — get_dim_values
text: indicator valid, returns 1x1 tibble column named 'value' stating "(PT) O codigo indicador nao existe. / (EN) indicator code exist."  Calling is_indicator_valid() using function recommended.

title: Get unique values for all dimensions of the indicator — get_dim_values

what: Get data from the INE API — get_ine_data
title: Get data from the INE API — get_ine_data
text: function actually performs API call.

title: Get data from the INE API — get_ine_data
code: get_ine_data(   indicator,   lang = "PT",   expected.duration = FALSE,   max_cells = 30000,   ... )

title: Get data from the INE API — get_ine_data
text: indicator INE indicator ID 7 character string. Example: "0010003". lang One "PT" "EN". Default "PT". expected.duration TRUE, prints expected remaining duration console. max_cells Integer smaller equal 40000, maximum number cells allowed API call. Default value 30000 ... Values Dimension indicator. parameter form DimN, N one {1, ..., Nº dimensions}. one dimensions included, output includes values default.

title: Get data from the INE API — get_ine_data
text: Dataset given indicator.

title: Get data from the INE API — get_ine_data
text: Extraction time can high (many hours) indicators many dimensions /many unique values. E.g. Indicator "0008206 - Deaths Place residence, Sex, Age group Death cause, Annual" take many hours extract.

title: Get data from the INE API — get_ine_data
code: get_ine_data("0010003") # A simple example #>    dim_1 geocod   geodsg valor #> 1   2010     PT Portugal 58.31 #> 2   2011     PT Portugal 60.04 #> 3   2012     PT Portugal 60.53 #> 4   2013     PT Portugal 58.92 #> 5   2014     PT Portugal  62.1 #> 6   2015     PT Portugal 61.28 #> 7   2016     PT Portugal 64.61 #> 8   2017     PT Portugal 64.55 #> 9   2018     PT Portugal 67.41 #> 10  2019     PT Portugal 69.16 #> 11  2020     PT Portugal 58.01 #> 12  2021     PT Portugal 60.72 #> 13  2022     PT Portugal 64.18 #> 14  2023     PT Portugal 66.08 get_ine_data("0008206", dim1 = "S7A1996", dim2 = c("11","111"),              dim4 = c(1,19), dim5 = "TLES") # A more complex example #>    dim_1 geocod     geodsg dim_3 dim_3_t dim_4        dim_4_t dim_5 #> 1   1996     11      Norte     2       M     1 Menos de 1 ano  TLES #> 2   1996     11      Norte     T      HM     1 Menos de 1 ano  TLES #> 3   1996     11      Norte     1       H     1 Menos de 1 ano  TLES #> 4   1996     11      Norte     2       M    19 85 e mais anos  TLES #> 5   1996     11      Norte     T      HM    19 85 e mais anos  TLES #> 6   1996     11      Norte     1       H    19 85 e mais anos  TLES #> 7   1996    111 Alto Minho     2       M     1 Menos de 1 ano  TLES #> 8   1996    111 Alto Minho     T      HM     1 Menos de 1 ano  TLES #> 9   1996    111 Alto Minho     1       H     1 Menos de 1 ano  TLES #> 10  1996    111 Alto Minho     T      HM    19 85 e mais anos  TLES #> 11  1996    111 Alto Minho     1       H    19 85 e mais anos  TLES #> 12  1996    111 Alto Minho     2       M    19 85 e mais anos  TLES #>                     dim_5_t valor #> 1  Todas as causas de morte   142 #> 2  Todas as causas de morte   338 #> 3  Todas as causas de morte   196 #> 4  Todas as causas de morte  4832 #> 5  Todas as causas de morte  7154 #> 6  Todas as causas de morte  2322 #> 7  Todas as causas de morte     7 #> 8  Todas as causas de morte    14 #> 9  Todas as causas de morte     7 #> 10 Todas as causas de morte   799 #> 11 Todas as causas de morte   262 #> 12 Todas as causas de morte   537

title: Get indicator metadata — get_metadata
text: get_metadata() calls metadata API. aware function still return value throw error indicator exist.

title: Get indicator metadata — get_metadata
Get indicator metadata — get_metadata
text: indicator INE indicator ID 7 character string. Example: "0010003". lang One "PT" "EN". Default "PT".

title: Get indicator metadata — get_metadata
text: API response body list.

title: Get indicator metadata — get_metadata
code: get_metadata("0010003") #> $IndicadorCod #> [1] "0010003" #>  #> $IndicadorNome #> [1] "Percentagem do orçamento de Estado financiado por impostos cobrados internamente (%); Anual - Direção Geral do Orçamento (Ministério das Finanças)" #>  #> $Periodic #> [1] "Anual" #>  #> $PrimeiroPeriodo #> [1] "2010" #>  #> $UltimoPeriodo #> [1] "2023" #>  #> $UnidadeMedida #> [1] "Percentagem (%)" #>  #> $Potencia10 #> [1] "0" #>  #> $PrecisaoDecimal #> [1] "2" #>  #> $Lingua #> [1] "PT" #>  #> $DataUltimaAtualizacao #> [1] "2022-12-28" #>  #> $DataExtracao #> [1] "2023-08-03T15:05:59.165+01:00" #>

what: ineptR: Get data from Statistics Portugal (Instituto Nacional de Estatistica - Portugal) to R — ineptR-package
title: ineptR: Get data from Statistics Portugal (Instituto Nacional de Estatistica - Portugal) to R — ineptR-package
text: Set wrapper helper functions facilitate interaction Statistics Portugal (Instituto Nacional de Estatistica - INE) API.

title: ineptR: Get data from Statistics Portugal (Instituto Nacional de Estatistica - Portugal) to R — ineptR-package
text: Maintainer: Carlos Matos carlosmdmatos@gmail.com (ORCID)

title: Check if indicator exists — is_indicator_valid
text: Indicator ID can found url 'indOcorrCod' query parameter browsing website. Example: https://www.ine.pt/xportal/xmain?xpid=INE&xpgid=ine_indicadores&indOcorrCod=0010003&contexto=bd&selTab=tab2

title: Check if indicator exists — is_indicator_valid
Check if indicator exists — is_indicator_valid
text: indicator INE indicator ID 7 character string. Example: "0010003". lang One "PT" "EN". Default "PT".

title: Check if indicator exists — is_indicator_valid
text: TRUE indicator exists, otherwise FALSE.

title: Check if indicator exists — is_indicator_valid
ineptR 0.1.0
text: First release
